citeinfo.origin: New York City Department of City Planning
citeinfo.title: New York City Selected Facilities and Program Sites 2008

pubinfo.publish: New York City Department of City Planning

descript.abstract: New York City Selected Facilities and Program Sites 2008 is a point theme representing public and private educational, recreational, public safety, health, mental health, substance abuse, mental retardation, day care, foster care, senior citizen and homeless facilities and programs throughout New York City. These facilities or programs are, with few exceptions, either operated, funded, licensed, or certified by a government agency. Attribute information includes the location, type, and capacity of each facility.
descript.purpose: This dataset has been formatted for use in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: This dataset is provided in two formats created by EDS staff, a file geodatabase and a shapefile. Also included are the original .txt tables provided by the NYC Planning Department

cntorgp.cntper: BYTES of the BIG APPLE Coordinator

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

horizpa.horizpar: Certain records of properties along the water contain X and Y coordinates of tax lots that extend into the water. Symbols created using these X and Y coordinates may be placed in the water on the map.

procstep.procdesc:
Data was compiled from the following sources for the following dates:
Schools New York State Education Department; Office of Elementary, Middle, Secondary and Continuing Education - 2006-2007 School Year New York State Education Department; Bureau of Post Secondary Research and Information - 2006-2007 School Year
Recreational and Cultural Facilities Brooklyn Public Library Fiscal - Year 2006 New York Public Library, Branch Services Fiscal Year - 2006 Queens Borough Public Library Fiscal Year - 2006 New York City Department of Parks and Recreation - November, 2007 New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic preservation - May, 2007 New York State Department of Environmental Conservation - March, 2007 National Parks Service/Gateway National Recreation Area - June, 2007 New York City Department of Cultural Affairs - Fiscal Year 2006
Public Safety and Criminal Justice Facilities New York City Fire Department - April, 2007 New York City Police Department, Administrative Services - March, 2007 New York City Department of Correction - March, 2007 New York City Department of Juvenile Justice - March, 2007 New York State Office of Children and Family Services - March, 2007 New York State Department of Correctional Services - February, 2007 New York City Office of the Criminal Justice Coordinator (Courts) - March, 2007
Hospitals, Nursing Homes and Ambulatory Health Facilities New York State Department of Health - May, 2007
Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Services New York State Office of Alcoholism and Substance Abuse - April, 2008 NYC Department of Mental Health and Mental Hygiene - Fiscal Year 2007
Mental Health Services New York State Office of Mental Health - January, 2008 NYC Department of Mental Health and Mental Hygiene - Fiscal Year 2007
Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities Services New York State Office of Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities - August, 2007 NYC Department of Mental Health and Mental Hygiene - Fiscal Year 2007
Day Care and Residential Facilities for Children New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene - October, 2007 New York City Administration for Childrens Services - January, 2008
Facilities for Seniors New York City Department for the Aging - July, 2007
Residential Facilities and Food Programs for Adults and Families New York City Department of Homeless Services - October, 2007 New York State Department of Health (Adult Homes) - May, 2007 Food for Survival (Soup Kitchens) - March, 2007
Values in this database's X and Y Coordinate fields correspond to the New York-Long Island State Plane Coordinate system and are derived from the centroids of the tax lots in the Tax Lot Base Map Files. Facility symbols can be mapped using these fields with both Tax Block and Tax Lot and the Administrative and Political District Base Map Files.
Approximately 2,300 records in this database that contain information on certain types of parkland properties (including transportation-related open spaces, former street properties, waterfront, or land under water) are not coded with tax block and tax lot numbers. The values in these records X and Y coordinate fields are derived from a GIS layer of open space from the Department of Parks and Recreation. In addition, the four records for Hudson River Park are not coded with tax block and tax lot numbers. The values in the X and Y coordinate fields of these four records are derived from the approximate center points of the four respective sections. Certain parkland properties which are located on multiple tax lots or multiple parcels not coded with tax lots are listed as multiple records in the database with multiple X and Y coordinates.
Digital Social Science Center (DSSC) staff projected the facility tables based on the included XY values and created a shapefile and a geodatabase.

overview.eaover:
DATA DICTIONARY FOR SELECTED FACILITIES AND PROGRAM SITES IN NEW YORK CITY
Field Name: ID Format: Alphanumeric - 14 characters Description: A unique identification number assigned to each facility.
Field Name: BORO Format: Numeric - 1 digit (9) Description: A one digit code identifying the borough in which the facility is located. This field is used for mapping selection. Code Decode 1 Manhattan 2 Bronx 3 Brooklyn 4 Queens 5 Staten Island
Field Name: BOROUGH Format: Alphanumeric - 2 characters Description: The two character borough abbreviation identifying the borough in which the facility is located. This field is used for output display. Code Decode MN Manhattan BX Bronx BK Brooklyn QN Queens SI Staten Island NOTE: Two areas in the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are each legally located in one borough but are serviced by another borough. Specifically, Marble Hill is serviced by the Bronx but is legally located in Manhattan. A facility located in Marble Hill has a Manhattan BOROUGH code. Rikers Island is serviced by Queens but is legally located in the Bronx. A facility located on Rikers Island has a Bronx BOROUGH code.
Field Name: CD Format: Numeric - 3 digits (999) Description: The community district or joint interest area of the facility. This field consists of three digits, the first of which contains the borough code (see BORO). The second and third digits contain the community district number or the joint interest area number, whichever is applicable. There are 59 community districts (CDs) in New York City, and 12 joint interest areas (JIAs) such as parks and airports that are not contained within any single CD. -3- Borough CD Code JIA Numbers & Descriptions Manhattan 101-112 164 Central Park Bronx 201-212 226 Van Cordtlandt Park 227 Bronx Park 228 Pelham Bay Park Brooklyn 301-318 355 Prospect Park 356 Brooklyn Gateway National Recreational Area Queens 401-414 480 LaGuardia Airport 481 Flushing Meadow/Corona Park 482 Forest Park 483 JFK International Airport 484 Queens Gateway National Recreational Area Staten Island 501-503 595 Staten Island Gateway National Recreational Area NOTE: Two areas in the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are legally located in one borough and are each serviced by another borough. Specifically, Marble Hill is legally located in Manhattan but is serviced by the Bronx. A facility located in Marble Hill has Bronx COMMUNITY DISTRICT codes of 207 or 208. Rikers Island is legally located in the Bronx but is serviced by Queens. A facility located on Rikers Island has Queens COMMUNITY DISTRICT code of 401.
Field Name CD-DECODE Format: Alphanumeric - 50 characters Description: A string of text specifying the borough and community district or joint interest area where the facility or program is located. Examples: Manhattan Community District 1, Or, Queens Gateway National Recreational Area.
Field Name BLOCK Format: Numeric - 5 digits (99999) Description: The tax block of the facility. This field is used for output display. Leading blanks precede the tax block when the data has less than 5 digits. If the facility is on more than one tax block, multiple occurrences of tax blocks are stored for the facility. Park properties defined as ?Joint NYCDOT/DPR Landscaped Area?, generally named ?GREENSTREET?, have not been assigned a block by the Parks Department. Certain park properties such as transportation-related open spaces, former street properties, and sometimes land under water have not been assigned a block by the Parks Department. The block number for these properties are coded in the following way: For property on a N/S street, the number of the block to the west is used. For property on a E/W street, the number of the block to the south is used.
Field Name: LOT Format: Numeric - 4 digits (9999) Description: The tax lot of the facility. This field is used for output display. Leading blanks precede the tax lot when the data has less than 4 digits. If the facility is on more than one tax lot, multiple occurrences of tax lots are stored for the facility. Park properties defined as ?Joint NYCDOT/DPR Landscaped Area?, generally named ?GREENSTREET?, have not been assigned a lot by the Parks Department. Some park properties are coded ?999" in this field by the Parks Department. These are generally transportation-related open spaces, former street properties, and sometimes land under water, as noted above under ?BLOCK?. ?999" is not a valid tax lot number.
Field Name: FACILITY-NAME Format: Alphanumeric - 70 characters Description: The name of the facility as identified by the source agency.
Field Name: FACILITY-ADDRESS Format: Alphanumeric - 80 characters Description: The address of the facility. The address is usually a house number and street name but can also be a house number range and a street name; two cross streets; or a place name (such as Floyd Bennett Field or Roosevelt Island).
Field Name: ZIP Format: Alphanumeric - 5 characters Description: The five character Zip Code associated with the facility's address.
Field Name: FACILITY-TYPE Format: Alphanumeric - 4 characters Description: A code identifying the specific type of facility or program. A range of codes identifies the general classification (i.e., primary function) of the facility. Smaller ranges within the general classification range identify more specific functions within the general classifications. Example: To obtain all Public Safety and Criminal Justice Facilities, select code range 2001-2999. To obtain only Criminal Justice Facilities, select code range 2501- 2699 from the Public Safety and Criminal Justice classification. To obtain only Correctional Facilities, select code range 2501-2599 from the larger Criminal Justice classification. To obtain a specific type of facility (e.g., City Correctional Facility), select its corresponding four character code (2521). Facility Type Range Code Decode Educational/Cultural/Recreational 1001-1999 Education Facilities 1001-1299 Public Schools 1001-1099 1001 Elementary School 1011 Elementary School - Charter 1002 Middle School 1012 K-8 School - Charter 1003 Intermediate/Junior High School Facility Type Range Code Decode 1013 Intermediate/Junior High School - Charter 1004 Junior/Senior High School 1014 Junior/Senior High School - Charter 1005 High School 1015 High School - Charter 1006 K-12 School 1016 K-12 School - Charter 1007 Special School 1099 Other School Private/Parochial Schools 1101-1199 1101 Elementary School 1102 Middle School 1103 Junior High School 1104 Junior/Senior High School 1105 Senior High School 1106 K-12 School 1107 Special School 1199 Other School Post Secondary Degree Granting Institutions 1201-1299 1201 SUNY 1202 CUNY 1203 Independent 1204 Proprietary Cultural/Recreational Facilities 1401-1699 Public Libraries 1401-1499 1401 Library - Public 1402 Central Library - Public NYC Dept. of Parks & 1501-1531 Recreation 1501 Park/Playground 1511 Pool, Gymnasium, Golf Course, Recreation Area 1521 Triangle, Mall, Strip, Sitting area 1531 Beach, Garden, Natural Area, Other 1541 Joint NYCDOT/DPR Landscaped Area NYS Office of Parks, Rec. & 1551 State Park Historic Preservation NYS Dept. of Environmental Conservation 1552 State Open Space Preserve National Park Service 1561 National Park Cultural Facilities 1601 NYC Cultural Institution Public Safety and Criminal Justice 2001-2999 Police/NYCHA Police 2001 Police Station 2002 Other NYPD Facility 2011 NYCHA Police Service Area Facility Type Range Code Decode Fire Department 2101 Fire House 2102 EMS (Emergency Medical Service) 2103 Fire Dept. Field Name: GROUP-TYPE Format: Numeric - 2 digits (99) Description: A code identifying an entire category of the facility types listed above. This field can be used for compiling reports of all types of facilities within one or more of ten main facility categories. The format of the sample report provided with the database would include headings with the name of the group or category. Example: The value 01 in the GROUP-TYPE field will select all schools in FACILITY-TYPE code range 1001-1999. Code Decode 01 School 02 Recreational or Cultural 03 Public Safety or Criminal Justice 04 Hospital/Nursing Home or Ambulatory Program 05 Alcoholism or Substance Service 06 Mental Health Service 07 Mental Retardation or Developmental Disabilities Service 08 Daycare or Residential Facility for Children 09 Facility for Seniors 10 Food Program or Residential Facility for Adults/Families
Field Name: SUBGROUP-TYPE Format: Numeric - 3 digits (999) Description: A code identifying a group of facilities or programs within the ten main categories or groups. This field can be used for compiling reports that include both GROUP-TYPE and SUBGROUP-TYPE headings. Example: Schools (GROUP-TYPE code 1) contains three subgroups. SUBGROUP-TYPE code 11 will select all public elementary and secondary schools in FACILITY-TYPE code range 1001-1099; code 12 will select all private elementary and secondary schools in FACILITYTYPE code range 1101-1199; and code 13 will select all colleges in FACILITY-TYPE code range 1201-1299. Code Decode 011 Public Elementary or Secondary School 012 Private Elementary or Secondary School 013 College or Other Post-Secondary Institution 021 Library or Cultural Institution 022 Park 041 Hospital/Inpatient Unit or Nursing Home 042 Ambulatory Facility or Program 051 Alcoholism or Sub. Abuse Service - Residential 052 Alcoholism or Sub. Abuse Service - Non-Residential 061 Mental Health Service - Residential 062 Mental Health Service - Non-Residential 071 Mental Retard. or Develop. Disab. Svc - Residential 072 Mental Retard. or Develop. Disab. Svc - Non-Residential 081 Residential Facility for Children 082 Daycare or Headstart Facility 101 Residential Facility for Adults & Families 102 Food Program or Drop-In Center
Field Name: CAPACITY Format: Numeric - 8 digits (99999999) Description: The capacity or service volume for the facility. The specific unit of measure (e.g., beds, books, caseload, etc.) of the capacity or service volume is contained in the Capacity Type field, and must be used in conjunction with this field.
Field Name: CAPACITY-TYPE Format: Numeric - 2 digits (99) Description: A code identifying the specific unit of measure of the facility's use. This field is used to define the capacity or service volume stored in the Capacity field. Code Decode 01 Day Care or Head Start Center Capacity 02 Certified Hospital Beds, or Certified Residential Facility Beds or Correctional Facility Beds 03 Book Circulation for the NY/BK/QN Borough Library 04 Average Daily Meals Served or Average Visits per Day (Health, Mental Health or Social Service Facility) 05 Residential Facility Units for Families 06 Outpatient Caseload or Day Program Facility Capacity 07 Average Meals Served or Average Visits Per Month 08 See Acreage Field 09 See Acreage Field; Value Represents Acreage of Total Property 10 Acreage Included in Total Property 11 Fall Enrollment, Full and Part-Time Students 12 Total Enrollment 13 Annual Visits 24 Supportive SRO units 96 Included in Main Campus Total 98 Unknown for this record 99 Not applicable or not collected for this facility type
Field Name: ACREAGE Format: Numeric - 9 digits (999999.99) Description: Acreage of parks. When a park property is comprised of more than one tax lot, it is listed as multiple records sorted by tax block and tax lot. Only the first tax lot is coded in this field with a value which represents the total acreage of the total property.
Field Name: K-8-ENROLL Format: Numeric - 8 digits (99999999) Description: Total lower school (kindergarten through 8th grade) enrollment, including modified instructional services, special instructional environments and other handicapped services, in the Public or Private/Parochial School.
Field Name: 9-12-ENROLL Format: Numeric - 8 digits (99999999) Description: Total high school (grades 9 through 12) enrollment, including modified instructional services, special instructional environments and other handicapped services, in the Public or Private/Parochial School.
Field Name: AGENCY-OPERATING Format: Numeric - 2 digits (99) Description: The government agency operating the facility or program (See Agency-Oversight Field for Code/Decode).
Field Name: AGENCY-OVERSIGHT Format: Numeric - 2 digits (99) Description: The government agency responsible for contracting for the services provided, or for licensing, certifying, funding or general oversight of the facility or service. Agency Range Code Decode New York City Agencies 01-49 01 Department of Education (DOE) 02 City University of New York (CUNY) 03 Department of Parks & Recreation (DPR) 04 Department of Cultural Affairs (DCA) 05 Brooklyn Public Library (BPL) 06 New York Public Library (includes Manhattan, the Bronx, and Staten Island) (NYPL) 07 Queens Borough Public Library (QBPL) 08 Police Department (NYPD) 10 Fire Department (FDNY) 11 Department of Correction (DOC) 12 Health & Hospitals Corporation (HHC) 14 Department of Health & Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) 15 Human Resources Administration (HRA) 16 Administration for Childrens Services (ACS) 17 ACS/Agency for Child Development (ACS/ACD) 18 Department of Juvenile Justice (DJJ) 19 Department of Homeless Services (DHS) 21 Department for the Aging (DFTA) 23 Department of Housing Preservation & Development (HPD) 24 Department of Transportation (DOT) New York State Agencies 50-69 50 Department of Education/Board of Regents 51 Department of Education/State University of New York (SUNY) 52 Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation 53 Department of Correctional Services 54 Department of Health 55 Office of Alcoholism & Substance Abuse Services 56 Office of Mental Health 57 Office of Mental Retardation & Developmental Disabilities Services 60 Office of Children & Family Services (OCFS) 61 Department of Environmental Conservation 62 Office of Court Administration Federal Agencies 70-89 70 Department of the Interior/National Park Service 72 Department of Justice/Bureau of Prisons 73 Veterans Administration 74 Administrative Office of the United States Courts Private Agencies 90-99 90 Proprietary 91 Not-For-Profit 92 Presumed Not-For-Profit 93 Private Non-Governmental 99 Unknown or Not Applicable
Field Name: CT2000 Format: Alphanumeric - 6 Characters Description: The 2000 census tract of the facility. This field is used for mapping selection. 2000 census tracts are geographic areas defined by the U.S. Census Bureau for the 2000 Census. This field contains a one to four character census tract number, which is preceded by leading zeros when necessary, and is followed by a two character suffix if applicable. There is no decimal point between the census tract number and its suffix. Example: 020201 If the census tract number has no suffix, the two rightmost positions will be blank. Example: 0203
Field Name: TRACT Format: Alphanumeric - 7 Digits including a decimal point (9999.99) Description: The 2000 census tract of the facility. This field is used for output display. The 2000 census tracts are geographic areas defined by the U.S. Census Bureau for the 2000 Census. This field contains a one to four character census tract number which is preceded by leading blanks, when necessary, (i.e., when the census tract number is less than four characters), and is followed by blanks or a decimal point and a two character suffix, when applicable. Example : b202.01, where b is a blank. If the census tract has no suffix, there will be no decimal point and the three rightmost characters will contain trailing blanks. Example : b203bbb, where b is a blank.
Field Name: COUNCIL Format: Numeric - 2 Digits (99) Description: A two digit code identifying the council district of the facility. There are 51 city council districts in New York City, which serve as administrative districts for the legislative branch of city government.
Field Name: SD Format: Numeric - 2 Digits (99) Description: The two digit code identifying the community school district of the facility.
Field Name: INSTRUCT-REGION Format: Numeric - 2 Digits (99) Description: The two digit code identifying the instructional region of the facility.
Field Name: POLICE-PREC Format: Numeric - 3 Digits (999) Description: The three digit code that identifies the police precinct servicing the facility. Code Decode 001, 005-007, 009-010, Manhattan South Precincts 013, 014, 017-018 019-020, 022-026, 028, Manhattan North Precincts 030, 032, 033, 034 040-049, 052 Bronx Precincts 050 Bronx-Marble Hill 060-063, 066-072, 078 Brooklyn South Precincts 076 Brooklyn South Piers 073, 075, 077, 079, Brooklyn North Precincts 081, 083, 088, 090, 094 084 Brooklyn North Piers 100-113, 115 Queens Precincts 114 Queens Roosevelt Island 120, 122, 123 Staten Island Precincts Field Name: HEALTH-AREA Format: Numeric - 4 digits (9999) Description: The four digit code identifying the health area of the facility. There is an implied decimal point after the first two digits. Health areas are administrative districts comprised of aggregates of census tracts, which are used by the Health Department for statistical data collection of births, deaths, abortions, communicable diseases, etc. This field is used in conjunction with the 'BORO' field for selection purposes. Code Decode 0100-4500, 4700-4800 Bronx Health Areas 0100-5020, 5200-9120, Brooklyn Health Areas 9300 0110-2100, 2310-2600, Manhattan Health Areas 2810, 2820, 3110-5000 0110-3900 Queens Health Areas 0100-8000, 0910, 0920 Staten Island Health Areas
Field Name: TBL Format: Numeric - 9 digits (999999999) Description: A combination of the tax block and the corresponding tax lot of the facility. This field is used for mapping selection. This field consists of the tax block followed by the tax lot. Leading blanks precede the tax block when it has less than 5 digits; leading zeros precede the tax lot when it has less than 4 digits. Example: bb1230002, where b is blank. If the facility is located on more than one tax block and/or tax lot combination, multiple occurrences will be stored for the facility. See notes under fields ?BLOCK? and ?LOT? on park properties defined as ?Joint NYCDOT/DPR Landscaped Area? and certain transportation related park properties.
Field Name: XCOORD Format: Numeric - 7 digits (9999999) Description: The X coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the facility. (Also see YCOORD). Facilities' X and Y coordinates must be used together for mapping selection. The XY coordinates are expressed in the New York Long Island State Plane coordinate system.
Field Name: YCOORD Format: Numeric - 7 digits (9999999) Description: The Y coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the facility. (Also see XCOORD). Facilities' X and Y coordinates must be used together for mapping selection. The XY coordinates are expressed in the New York Long Island State Plane coordinate system.
